name: AnvilInventory
description: The `AnvilInventory` class provides specialized access to Minecraft's anvil interface, allowing scripts to interact with anvil operations such as renaming items, repairing items, and combining enchantments. This class extends the base `Inventory` class and adds anvil-specific functionality for managing the rename field, level costs, and input/output slots.

methods.name: getName
methods.description: Retrieves the custom name currently set in the anvil's rename field. This reflects the text entered by the player, not necessarily the item's default name.

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the custom name in the anvil's rename field. This will update the output item and recalculate the level cost.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The new name to set for the item in the output slot.

methods.name: getLevelCost
methods.description: Returns the experience level cost for the current anvil operation (renaming, repairing, or combining enchantments). Returns 0 if no valid operation is possible.

methods.name: getItemRepairCost
methods.description: Returns the prior work penalty (repair cost) of the item currently in the left input slot. This cost increases with each repair/operation performed on the item.
examples:
// Example from calculateAnvilCosts function:
Chat.log(`Base repair cost: ${inv.getItemRepairCost()}`);

methods.name: getMaximumLevelCost
methods.description: Returns the maximum experience level cost an anvil operation can have, which is typically 40 in Minecraft.

methods.name: getLeftInput
methods.description: Returns an `ItemStackHelper` object representing the item currently placed in the left input slot (slot 0) of the anvil.
examples:
// Example from autoRepair function:
if (!leftItem.isDamageable()) { Chat.log("Item cannot be repaired"); return; }

methods.name: getRightInput
methods.description: Returns an `ItemStackHelper` object representing the item currently placed in the right input slot (slot 1) of the anvil, used for repairs or enchantment combinations.
examples:
// Example from combineEnchantments function:
if (leftItem.isEmpty() || rightItem.isEmpty()) { Chat.log("Please place two enchanted items in the anvil"); return; }

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Returns an `ItemStackHelper` object representing the item that will result from the current anvil operation, found in the output slot (slot 2). This item might be empty if no valid operation is possible.
